title: Takoroka
content:
Takoroka is a gear brand within the Splatoon series. Takoroka gear has a 5× chance of rolling Special Charge Up, and a 0.5× chance of rolling Special Duration Up in Splatoon or Special Power Up in Splatoon 2 and Splatoon 3.

Takoroka's theme appears to be clothing for active, fit Inklings. This can be by some of their clothing, like modern-style running shoes, a vector patterned shirt and a mesh cap for blocking sunlight. However, they also produce sports clothing, such as rugby shirts and studded soccer shoes.

According to the SplatoonJP Twitter, Takoroka mainly produces many pairs of shoes, and also professional sportswear like rugby shirts and spiked shoes. It is popular among young Inklings who are particular about their attire.[1]

- Its logo resembles an Inkling in squid form, or the emoticon くコ:ミ in reverse.

- A statue of the Takoroka logo can be seen in the background of Museum d'Alfonsino in Splatoon, Industrial Toast in Splatoon 2, and Toastmaster Station in the Octo Expansion.

- In Splatoon, there is no Takoroka gear that has Cold Blooded, Comeback, Haunt, Ink Recovery Up, Last-Ditch Effort, Ninja Squid, Opening Gambit, Recon, Special Charge Up, Swim Speed Up, or Tenacity as a primary ability.

- In Splatoon 2, there is no Takoroka gear that has Comeback, Haunt, Last-Ditch Effort, Opening Gambit, Special Charge Up, Swim Speed Up or Tenacity as a primary ability.

- In Splatoon 3, there is no Takoroka gear that has Comeback, Intensify Action, Last-Ditch Effort, Ninja Squid, Object Shredder, Opening Gambit, Respawn Punisher, Special Charge Up, or Tenacity as a primary ability.

- The Takoroka logo can be found on the propellers of Salmonid Smokeyard.

- Alongside Cuttlegear, both brands are the only ones that have at least one piece of gear changed to an another brand. In this case FC Albacore was changed to Enperry as its brand.
